attributes.action: UK Government to retract second lockdown, those deemed vulnerable to shelter.
attributes.additional_details: UK Government out of touch with public opinion.  livelihoods, mental health and children's future are being damaged for a virus with an extremely low mortality rate. Money wasted on track and trace and furlough should be invested into NHS capacity.
attributes.background: Government to retract second lockdown measures and instead re-open hospitality venues following COVID guidelines.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Repeal second National Lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557045

Do not implement a second national lockdown or other restrictions this winter: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549862

Referendum on current restrictions and any further lockdowns: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551539

Fund & provide services to allow the vulnerable to shield & re-open the economy: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552023
